title: Divinity Original Sin 2
notes: In '.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2/bin' Changed SupportTool.exe to SupportTool.exe.bak and renamed EoCApp.exe to SupportTool.exe. Launched the game, wait for it to fail, then run: /tmp/proton_run winecfg   -Under libraries add xaudio2_7 set to native, builtin

title: Divinity Original Sin 2 Definitve Edition
notes:
I did all that was described in the following post: "After the definitive edition update, go to .steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2, mv bin to bin.bak and ln -s DefEd/bin; then cd into....etc."
However,  in my case the game complained that it wasn't able to create the directory "\\?\\Larian Studios", which turned out to be the savegame folder, which is the following: THE_STEAM_LIBRARY_CONTAINING_THE_GAME/steamapps/compatdata/435150/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/Larian Studios. After I created the folder the game worked perfectly.

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
notes: Previous edition worked properly when renaming EoCApp.exe. Once updated the game won't start anymore.

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
notes:
After the definitive edition update, go to .steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2, mv bin to bin.bak and ln -s DefEd/bin; then cd into DefEd/bin, mv SupportTool.exe to SupportTool.exe.bak and rename/softlink EoCApp.exe to SupportTool.exe
Definitive Edition could be run without the xaudio2_7 override.
For running the classic version, you need to do the dll override, ln -s Classic bin in top level and folder and do the similar exe renames in the Classic/ folder.

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
notes:
In both '.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2/DefEd/bin' and '.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2/Classic/bin' Change SupportTool.exe to SupportTool.exe.bak and renamed EoCApp.exe to SupportTool.exe. 

Launch the game, wait for it to fail, then run: /tmp/proton_run winecfg -Under libraries add xaudio2_7 set to native, builtin

In '.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2/' rename the bin directory to bin.bak.  Create a symbolic link to either Classic or DefEd based on the version you want to play 'ln -s DefEd/bin/ bin' or 'ln -s Classic/bin bin'

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
notes: I have tried what other users reported to make it work. Such as renaming EocApp.exe to SupportTool.exe and creating a symbolic link for the bin folder to go to Definitive Edition, including wincfg to use windows 10, and adding xaudio2_7. Tried to run outside steam, and change the settings for wine/proton to make it work but in the end I get the same result. A black screen with the game pointer. I can move it but nothing else.

title: INSIDE
notes: Full game playthrough with constant 60fps. Initial loading time was quite long. All other loading times were quick. Gamepad didn't work (used Antimicro instead), 1 crash after alt-tab (other times I used alt-tab it worked fine), slightly noisy sound in 2 sections.

Consider it Silver if you want to play with controller. I used the same renaming trick, that everyone else did, I also had to do $ protontricks 435150 win7. After this, game ran beautifully. I run it on High details and it gets 60fps+ (except main menu). Controller does not work (but I think it can be worked around somehow).

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon R9 200 Series (HAWAII, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.5-90.current, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes:
Game runs perfectly after following these instructions: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/413#issuecomment-421811307 . In case you don't have wine-staging 3.16 installed, download it (for example using lutris) and modify the rsync command, so it points to the right directory. 
For some reason, downloading Mods from the workshop doesn't work, so I had to manually create a folder called "Mods" in /home/USER/Documents/Larian Studios/Divinity Original Sin 2 Definitive Edition/ and copy the downloaded Mods located in  /home/USER/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/workshop/content/435150 to the new folder.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes: After doing the softlinks and renaming the exe's, the game launches via Steam perfectly. About 80 hours played so far.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes:
After following the github instructions here:
https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/413#issuecomment-421811307

With a slightly different Rsync command:
rsync -avP --existing /usr/ ./
Being in the dist path in the custom Proton path of-course.

I was able to get steam to go from "starting the game" to "running" for about 5 seconds, then it acts like the game closed and nothing is running anymore.
Seems like a process starts then dies...
About all I can tell out of it.
I am running multi-monitor and i3 window manager. Shouldn't have anything to do with it but probably should mention it.

title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes:
The tweaks to copy over the files as previous comments mentioned were required, but after that, game launch still failed (with NVIDIA 380x drivers) with an error about my graphics card not having DX11 support.  After upgrading to NVIDIA 410x series drivers, it worked!  Here are the commands in full to copy off the files (replace "${HOME}/.local/share" with whatever your install dir is):
cd "${HOME}/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Divinity Original Sin 2" ; mv bin bin2; ln -s DefEd/bin bin; cd DefEd/bin; mv SupportTool.exe SupportTool.exe.bak; cp EoCApp.exe SupportTool.exe;
systemInfoNotes: At first tried with NVIDIA 380, which didn't work!
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes:
Firstly, I had to apply renaming fixes. It did help to run the game, but on the initial loading screen it threw "Failed to create dir" error, so here is the fix:

Firstly, disable Steam Cloud for the game. Then go to "~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/435150/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents" and delete "Larian Studios" folder, then launch the game. That's it. 

However, enabling Steam Cloud brings the problem back, and I'm not sure why. I played this game about a year ago on Windows, maybe this is why. It was before Definitive edition. Weird.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes: After the fixes to renaming the files and symlinking it worked great. Had it freeze up when I host a session and someone joined me, but I can join and play with others no issues whatsoever.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes: Followed the recommended steps, rename EOC and support tool, after that runs flawlessly.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes: Renamed the files as instructed, removed the "Larian Studios" folder from compatdata. Game runs perfectly without any noticeable performance hit.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition

notes: See the recommendations in here. tl;dr: rename bin, symlink DefEd/bin/ to bin, rename DefEd/bin/SupportTool.exe, rename EoCApp.exe to SupportTool.exe in DefEd/bin. SP works, MP works.
title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
